result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis N. Ovard

records.addlTxt: Transcript from 10/28/2022 preliminary hearing

Pre-trial conference on November 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on December 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

[ma] Case called at 9:39am
Defendant Travis N. Ovard in court.  Attorney Cassi Nelson in court for Travis N. Ovard.  Attorney Theresa A Beck in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Officer Zubke-sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Beck
--cross examination by Attorney Nelson

The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Ovard committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 9:53am  

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 11/16/22 at 9:00am  (2) Status Conference on 12/16/22 at 11:00am
JA review of 10/21/22 RUMS
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (ae/10/24/22)
JA's Review of 10/07 RUMS
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (10/07) ML
Preliminary hearing on October 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Travis N. Ovard
Current: 415 N Church St, Watertown, WI 53098 United States  (Effective: 10-03-2022)
Prior: 115 S. 1st St., Watertown, WI 53094
Preliminary hearing on October 21, 2022 at 09:30 am. {INCORRECT NOTICE -AR}

[ae] case called 1:52 PM Defendant Travis N. Ovard appeared by Zoom. Attorney Cassi Nelson appeared by Zoom.  Attorney Flint in court for State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. Todays hearing is scheduled for voluntary appearance

The Court requires a $100 CASH Bond with same conditions:
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--Defendant is to post no later than 12:00 pm on 10/3/2022

recess 2:06  pm. 

NEXT: (1) Preliminary Hearing 10/21/22 at 9:30 am
Request approved
Voluntary appearance on September 30, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
letter requesting voluntary appearance
Extradition Forecast
Returnable to any Jefferson County magistrate.

[MK] case called at 8:57am  
Defendant Travis N Ovard does not appear. Attorney Cassi Nelson appears. ADA  Krysta Parson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
This case is scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today and the State's officer-witness is present.
The Court orders issuance of a Bench Warrant-Body Only, returnable to any Jefferson County magistrate.
recess 8:58am
JA's Review of 09/07 RUMS
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (09/09) ML

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel - Att Nelson
Scheduling Order

Pre-trial conference on September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[MK] case called at 1:26 PM 
Defendant Travis N. Ovard appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Nelson agrees that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $500 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
recess 1:30pm. 

NEXT: (1) clerk- add PD Office to the mailing matrix,  (2) Pretrial Conference on September 14th at 8:30am--only counsel need to appear,   (3) Preliminary Hearing on September 23rd at 8:30am
Agency: Watertown PD
